ORGANIZED EXPEDITIONS
Our firm offers, organized expeditions with a limited number of people in each one of them. The dates and the capacity are already arranged to give our services a higher quality.
  DATES for organized expeditions
• December 15th to January 1st
• December 25th to January 11th
• January 10th to February 26th
• January 15th to January 31st
• January 25th to February 11th
• February 5th to February 21st
"Contact us in case our dates are not convenient for you, since we have at our disposal enough staff and infrastructure to prepare a schedule up to you"
OUR EXPEDITION day by day
BACK TO TOP [ + ]

Day 1, arrival at Mendoza. Receiving at the airport or bus station. Transport to the hotel.

Our expedition starts in Mendoza, at the airport or bus station, the staff of Lanko expediciones will be waiting for you.
Then, you will be taken to the hotel by our vehicles.
Later on, we will meet the guide, the assistant and all the other members of the expedition to check our gear. This is a very important task, since Mendoza is the last place to obtain the necessary equipment for the expedition.

Day 2, obtaining of permits. Transfer to Penitentes-Puente de Inca, (a mountain village which is 180km away from Mendoza and only 3km from the entrance of the Aconcagua Provincial Park.)

We will be taken by a minibus from the hotel to the tourism undersecretaryship to get the climbing permits. Afterwards we will undertake our trip to Penitentes-Puente de Inca (2,700mts above sea level), we are going to stay there, in a hotel or a shelter.
Here, we will prepare all the things which then will be taken by our mules to the base camp (Plaza de Mulas 4,250mts a.s.l.).

Day 3-4, rapprochement from Penitentes-Puente de Inca towards Plaza de Mulas (base camp).

After having spent a night in Penitentes-Puente de Inca, we will be transported to Horcones, the entrance of the Aconcagua Provincial Park.
From this place we begin the two-day rapprochement trek to the base camp, approximately
40 km.
The first day we will camp in Confluencia-3,500mts a.s.l. and 3 or 5 hours away from the starting point.
Here join the rivers lower Horcones from Plaza Francia, base camp of the long-feared south face; and upper Horcones from Plaza de Mulas, our destination.
The following day we will start an 8 or 10 hour-long walk through Playa Ancha refugio Teniente Ibañez and then, Cuesta Brava.We will arrive at Plaza de Mulas in the evening.

Day 5-8, rest and aclimatazation.

We will make a good use of the first two days in Plaza de Mulas to rest and to go over the place. The following day we will take some things to camp I, Plaza Canadá at 4,900mts a.s.l.
caming back later to the base and we will be able to gain high and lighten our backpacks.
One more day in the base camp will be very useful to recover our forces.

Day 9, ascent to camp I, Plaza Canadá.

We will undertake the ascent depending on the general conditions of the group. Camp I is 700mts further.
Day 10, ascent to camp II, Nido de Cóndores..

We Hill go from camp I to camp II very early in the morning. It is 5,350mts a.s.l.. Here we will be able to watch one of the most impressing sunsets you have ever seen.
Later on, we will have dinner and get ready for a very cold night.


Day 11, ascent to camp III, Berlin..

We will climb to camp III, 6,900mts a.s.l., this will be our last place to pass the night. Only 1,000mts separate us from the long-awaited “top of America”.

Day 12, ascent to the "summit", 6,962 mts

The most important day of our expedition will begin very early, approximately 4:30 AM.
We will departure after having a very heavy breakfast.
We will go from Filo Norte towards Refugio Independencia, 6,500mts a.s.l.. Then, Portezuelo del Viento, and afterwords towards La Canaleta, (a 300 mts big slope), which flows into El Filo del Guanaco, here we can watch the south face, from this moment just a short distance separates us from the long-desired summit.

Just a moment later the emotion will be uncontainable, you´ll realize your efforts weren´t in vain, nothing will interpose between your eyes and the infinite; you will only hear your heart palpitating like a drum, you´ll be at the top of America.
“THE TOP OF ACONCAGUA”

Later, we´ll come back to camp III to rest.

Day 13-14, extra day in case of bad weather or coming back to the base

Since weather conditions in Aconcagua are very changeable , we keep two days for ourselves to climb to the summit and we will have more chances to reach it.

If the weather is favorable we will came back to the base to celebrate.

Day 15, descent from base camp towards Penitentes-Puente de Inca.

We came back from the base to the entrance of the park -Horcones- it is an eight or ten-hour long walk, and a vehicle of our firm will be waiting to take us to the hotel-shelter.

Day 16, transport from Penitentes-Puente de Inca to Mendoza.

A minibus belonging to our firm will take us to the hotel in Mendoza city.
At night we will celebrate with all the entrants of the expedition.

Day 17, transport to the bus station or the airport.

We will take you to the bus station or the airport.

END OF OUR SERVICES.
Included services
Subir [ + ]
• Cook in base camp
• Assistance for obtaining of permits
• Medical attention in base camp.
• Permanent radial communication BLU with Mendoza-Penitentes-Puente del Inca-Plaza de Mulas and VHF with the base and altitude camps .
• All meals and drinks included during the rapprochement and climbing.
• Transport in mules in case of medical emergency.
• Dining tent in base camp.
• Advice and gear rental.
• Bedroom tents.
• Own bathrooms in base camp.
• Tents to store the gear.
• Asistencia médica en el campo base.
 
 
   
Necessary personal equipment for the expedition:
Subir [ + ]
Clothes:
• polypropylene underwear, capilene or something similar (not cotton)
• fleece trousers and jacket
• trousers and jacket must be waterproof and easy to perspire; we suggest Gore-Tex or similar
• Note: wear trousers with lateral zipper, in order to put them on faster and easier 



Hands:
 • .Interior polypropylene gloves or similar
• Thick fingerless glove, wool, fleece or similar
• Gore-Tex fingerless glove cover or similar
Feet:
 
• Confortable trekking snakers or similar
• Double plastic boots, we recommend Koflach, Azolo, Iowa, etc.
Head:
 • Sunhat and balaclava
Technical
Gear:
 • light ice-ax, 60 or 70 cm, depending on the height
• quickly wearing crampons, 12 points with few ribbons
• ski sticks
General Gear :
Subir [ + ]
• Backpack: capacity 70 liters, rigid back, hard-wearing material with porta ice-ax and place for crampons.
  Non structural
• Regular backpack
• Sleeping bag: high quality, duvet, to endure temperatures of -25°C
• Sleeping pads, closed cell, neoprene or inflatable
• Heavy weight down jacket
• Gaiters Gore-Tex
• Socks: thick, thin. At least 2 pears of each
• Water bottle and vacuum flask: capacity 1 liter, wide-mouth
• Head lamp (Petzel).
• Sunglasses, 100%UV protection, with side shields, extra pair
• Victorinox penknife or similar
• Sunscreen. Minimum of spf 30-40 or full protection and lip protection
• Mini first-aid kit
• Camera
Ttip Gear:
Subir [ + ]
to transport your general gear from Penitentes-Puente de Inca to Plaza de Mulas, you need a big and resistant bag, like a duffel bag, and a small one, to leave your belongings in our store.
 
 
TREKKINGS day by day
Subir [ + ]
Our firm has three different organized itineraries so as you can enjoy an unforgettable experience, and know the different bases of Aconcagua, the highest mountain of America.
South face-Plaza Francia(4,100mts a.s.l.)

Day 1: oobtaining of permits. Transport to Penitentes-Puente de Inca. Accommodations and dinner in the shelter.

 Day 2: breakfast, transportation to the entrance of the park. Beginning of the trek to Confluencia (3,500mts a.s.l.), 3-4 hour-long walk.
                 Dinner after pitching the tents.

Day 3: breakfasr, trek to Plaza Francia(4,100mts a.s.l.), 4-5 hour-long walk. Lunch while walking and dinner in Confluencia..

Day 4: breakfast and return to Penitentes-Puente de Inca. Visit to the thermal waters in Puente de Inca.

Day 5: return to the hotel in Mendoza by minibus. End oftrek.

West face-Plaza de Mulas (4,230mts a.s.l.)

Day 1: obtaining of permits. Transfer to Penitentes-Puente de Inca. Accommodations and dinner in the shelter.

Day 2: breakfast, transportation to the entrance of the park. Beginning of the trek to Confluencia (3,500mts a.s.l.), 3-4 hour-long walk.
                 Dinner after pitching the tents.

Day 3: breakfast and beginning of the trek to Plaza de Mulas. Dinner.

Day 4: breakfast. Trek in the area. Free day. Celebration dinner.

Day 5: breakfast and return to Penitentes-Puente de Inca. Visit to the thermal waters in Puente de Inca.

Day 6:return to the hotel in Mendoza by minibus. End of the trek.

Included services
Subir [ + ]
• Trekking guide
• Transportation to the entrance of the park
• Transporte a la entrada del parque
• Accommodation in Penitentes. Half board
 
 
• Bedroom tents
• Dining tents and kitchen in the base of the mountain, with tables, chairs, dishes, electric light
• Transport of gear by mules round-trip
 
• Assistance for obtaining of permits
• All meals and drinks included during the trek
• Gear storage.
• BLU and VHF radios.
• Medical attention in the base camp
